children.name: sb who studys at a school or university
learner
children.definition: sb who is learning about a particular subject - used especially by teachers and people talking about the needs of students: học viên
examples: A major aim of education is to improve learners’ understanding of the world around them.
At the end of each chapter there is a series of exercises designed to help the learner.

children.name: the needs of the learner
examples: The language in the coursebook is controlled to meet the needs of the learner.

children.name: scholar
children.definition: sb who studies a subject in great detail, especially at university and one that is not a science subject: học giả
examples: a Shakespearean scholar
a classics/history scholar
a distinguishedscholar
Dr Miles was adistinguishedscholarofRussian history.

children.name: student
children.usage: [In British English, studentis not usually used to refer to a child at primary school]
children.definition: sb who is studying at a university or school: học sinh, sinh viên
examples: She’s a student at Cornell University.
extra help for disabled students
student at
a first-year student at the University of Oslo
student of
Wiggins was a student of theology for many years before leaving the seminary.
student daysthe time when you were a student
Mira hadn’t seen Brad since their student days at the University of Wisconsin.

children.name: a law/medical/chemistry etc student
examples: Approximately 40% of law students are women.

children.name: a university/college/school student
examples: How many college students are politically active?

children.name: a high school/elementary school student
examples: American English Her son is a high school student.

children.name: a first-year/second-year etc student
children.definition: in their first year, second year etc at college or university
examples: First-year students have an exam at the end of term.

children.name: an A/B/C studentAmerican English
children.definition: one who usually gets an A, B, or C for their work
examples: He was an A student all the way through high school.

children.name: an undergraduate student
children.definition: one who is studying for a first degree
examples: Most undergraduate students rely on student loans for finance.

children.name: a postgraduate studentBritish English,a graduate studentAmerican English
children.definition: one who has already done a first degree
examples: There is a separate university prospectus for postgraduate students.

children.name: a research student
children.definition: doing research in a university
examples: When I returned to Cambridge, I continued this work with two of my research students.

children.name: a mature studentespecially British English
children.definition: a student who is over 25 years old
examples: He took a degree as a mature student at Birmingham University.

children.name: a foreign/overseas student
examples: The University welcomes applications from overseas students.

children.name: a student loan/grant
children.definition: money that is lent or given to a student
examples: Some of them are still paying off student loans.

children.name: student life
children.definition: the way of life of university and college students
examples: Parties are an important part of student life.

children.name: a student teacher/doctor/nurse
children.definition: someone who is learning to be a teacher, doctor, or nurse
examples: Student teachers work alongside qualified teachers to gain classroom experience.

children.name: pupil
children.definition: especially UKsb who is being taught in a particular school or by a particular teacher:
examples: The school has 300 pupils.
He received a letter from one of his former pupils.
About 20 pupils study music here.
staff and pupils
astar pupil(= a very good one )
a third-grade pupil

children.name: schoolchild/ schoolkidinformal especially British
children.definition: achildwho studies at a school:
examples: Only 10% of British schoolchildren attend private schools.
The play was performed by a group of local schoolchildren.

children.name: schoolboy
children.definition: /schoolgirlespecially UK a boy or girl who goes to school – used especially when talking about how they behave, or that time in someone’s life:
examples: They were behaving like naughty schoolgirls.
When he was a schoolboy, no one had heard of computers.
He blushed at her like a schoolboy.

children.name: learner
children.definition: sb who is learning a particular subject or skill, especially a foreign language and usually in a school: học viên, người học
examples: A good teacher holds the learner’s interest and stimulates them to find out more.
learner of
a new dictionary for learners of business English
a language learnera textbook for language learners

children.name: a slow learner
children.definition: someone who learns things slowly
examples: The computer program means that slow learners can practise as long as they need to.

children.name: a quick/fast learner
children.definition: someone who learns things quickly
examples: She was a quick learner, and her English got better day by day.

children.name: an adult learner
examples: Many adult learners also work full-time.

children.name: a young learner
children.definition: a learner who is a child
examples: The activities are good for young learners.

children.name: an intermediate learner
examples: These exercises are designed for intermediate learners.

children.name: an advanced learner
examples: Mastering idioms and phrasal verbs is frequently the greatest challenge facing the advanced learner of English.

children.name: a foreign learner
examples: Foreign learners of English often find it difficult to hear the unstressed parts of a word.

children.name: a learner driver
examples: Learner drivers often tend to grip the steering wheel too tightly.

children.name: trainee
children.definition: someone who is being trained for a job while working in a company or organization: thực tậpsinh
examples: The new class of trainees was highly motivated.
I started out as a trainee on the trading floor, earning around $25,000 a year.

children.name: trainee accountant/ reporter/ salesman etc
examples: I got a job as a trainee reporter on the ‘Daily Star’.
He spent three years as a trainee manager before getting his present position.

children.name: apprentice
children.definition: sb who works for an employer for a fixed period of time in order to learn a particular skill or job, especially a job that they do with their hands: người học nghề
examples: When I finish classes, I’m hoping to land a summer job as a chef’s apprentice.

children.name: apprenticeship[
examples: C or U] the period of time when you are an apprentice:

children.name: apprentice electrician/ bricklayer/ hairdresser etc
examples: I worked as an apprentice electrician for 18 months.

children.name: serve an apprenticeship
examples: A ‘Meister’ in Germany serves a nine-year apprenticeship before he can run his own shop.

children.name: apprentice to
examples: John recalled his apprenticeship to a blacksmith in the early years of the Second World War.

children.name: beginner
children.definition: a person who is starting to learn sth for the first time:
examples: This judo class is for beginners only.

children.name: a group of students in a school, college etc
class
children.definition: a group of students or schoolchildren who are taught together:
examples: Which class are you in this year?
She gave the whole class extra homework for a week.
My class (= The people in my class) was/were rather noisy this morning.

children.name: grade
children.definition: a class or group of classes for children of a particular age in an American school:
examples: third-/fourth-/fifth- etc grader[C] a child in the third, fourth, fifth etc grade:
According to the test, 40% of fourth-graders are not reading at the basic level.

children.name: third/seventh/twelfth etc grade
examples: She’s in the fifth grade.
I really liked my eighth grade math teacher.
The second grade class is doing a play about the Pilgrims.

children.name: forma class or a group of classes for all the children of the same age in a British
children.definition: school for children between 11 and 18: khối lớp
examples: She’s by far the brightest pupil in the form.
third-/fourth-/fifth- etc former[C] a child in the third, fourth, fifth etc form:
Some of the fifth-formers have started a rock band.

children.name: third/fourth/fifth etc form
examples: I’m in the third form.
Mrs Davies took the fifth form to the science museum.

children.name: year
children.definition: all the classes for children of a particular age in a UK school or for students in a particular year of study at a UK university: khối, khóa
examples: He works a lot harder than most of the students in his year.
third-/fourth-/fifth- etc year[C] a student in the third, fourth, fifth etc year:
A group of fourth-years are collecting money for food aid to Africa.

children.name: third/fourth/fifth etc year
examples: There are 130 children in the second year.
I hated teaching the fifth year. They were always causing trouble.

children.name: seta class for children with a particular level of ability in a British
children.definition: school:
examples: She’s in set one for maths and English and set two for history.
I was useless at school -- always in the bottom set in every subject.
We think you’ve improved sufficiently to go up to a higher set.

children.name: a student of a particular year
freshman
children.definition: US sb who is in the first year at a high school or university: học sinh, sinh viên năm nhất
examples: We were only freshmen, so the older kids liked to pick on us.

children.name: freshman class/ year/ course etc
examples: Chris remembers his freshman year at UCLA as if it were yesterday.

children.name: sophomore
children.definition: US sb who is in the second year at a high school or university: học sinh, sinh viên năm hai
examples: This class is mainly for freshmen and sophomores.

children.name: sophomore class/year etc
examples: George dropped out of college his sophomore year.

children.name: junior
children.definition: US sb who is in the third year at a high school or university: học sinh, sinh viên năm ba
examples: a junior at NYU
junior class/year etc
Donna spent spring semester of her junior year in Paris.

children.name: senior
children.definition: US sb who is in the fourth and final year at a high school or university: học sinh, sinh viên năm tư
examples: I can’t believe that Cari is a high school senior already.

children.name: senior class/year etc
examples: The entire senior class took a trip to Disneyworld.

children.name: sb who has finished the first degree or not
graduate
children.definition: (informalgrad) US a person who has finished their school, college or university education:
examples: ahigh-school graduate
a graduateofYale

children.name: graduate
children.definition: a person who has a first degree from a university or college: sinh viên đã tốt nghiệp
examples: a Harvard graduate
graduate of
a graduate of Edinburgh University
university graduates
a history graduate
graduate in
He’s a graduate in philosophy.

children.name: undergraduate
children.definition: sb who is studying at a university in order to get their first degree: sinh viên chưa tốt nghiệp
examples: They met when they were undergraduates at Cambridge.
The loans, which are based on financial need, are limited to $3000 for undergraduates.

children.name: postgraduate
children.definition: UK /graduatestudentUS  sb who is studying for a higher degree after their first degree: sinh cao học
examples: About half the graduate students in the program come from overseas.
He has three postgraduates helping him with his research.

children.name: studious
children.definition: sb who is studious likes to spend their time reading and studying in order to be more successful at school, college etc: chăm học
examples: Francis didn’t bother with clothes or make-up. She was an extremely serious and studious young girl.
Angus’s round glasses made him look studious.

children.name: swot
children.definition: UK /grindUS  informal sb who spends too much time studying:
examples: Everyone else in the class hated him because they thought he was a real swot.

children.name: classmate
children.definition: sb who is in the same class as you at school:
